org.springdata.cassandra.cql.spec
Class ColumnSpecification

java.lang.Object
  org.springdata.cassandra.cql.spec.ColumnSpecification

public class ColumnSpecification
extends Object

Builder class to help construct CQL statements that involve column manipulation. Not threadsafe.

Use name(String) and #type(String) to set the name and type of the column, respectively. To specify a PRIMARY KEY column, use clusteringKeyPart() or clusteringKeyPart(Ordering). To specify that the PRIMARY KEY column is or is part of the partition key, use partitionKeyPart() instead of clusteringKeyPart() or clusteringKeyPart(Ordering).

Author:
Matthew T. Adams, Alex Shvid

partitionKeyPart

public ColumnSpecification partitionKeyPart()
Identifies this column as a primary key column that is also part of a partition key. Sets the column's keyPart to KeyPart.PARTITION and its ordering to null.

Returns:
this

partitionKeyPart

public ColumnSpecification partitionKeyPart(boolean enable)
Toggles the identification of this column as a primary key column that also is or is part of a partition key. Sets ordering to null and, if the given boolean is true, then sets the column's keyPart to KeyPart.PARTITION, else sets it to null.

Returns:
this

clusteringKeyPart

public ColumnSpecification clusteringKeyPart()
Identifies this column as a primary key column with default ordering. Sets the column's keyPart to KeyPart.CLUSTERING and its ordering to DEFAULT_ORDERING.

Returns:
this

clusteringKeyPart

public ColumnSpecification clusteringKeyPart(Ordering order)
Identifies this column as a primary key column with the given ordering. Sets the column's keyPart to KeyPart.CLUSTERING and its ordering to the given Ordering.

Returns:
this

clusteringKeyPart

public ColumnSpecification clusteringKeyPart(Ordering ordering,
                                             boolean enable)
Toggles the identification of this column as a primary key column. If the given boolean is true, then sets the column's keyPart to KeyPart.PARTITION and ordering to the given Ordering , else sets both keyPart and ordering to null.

Returns:
this
